instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message:
got this MacBook air in, wouldn't not start.
I plug in the charger and it gives me a nice long dong.
turned of and picked up next day because of time .

day after... only quarter fan spin.no liquid damage anywhere the board is clean "as babys bottom" no shrek shit anywhere.

after measuring and searching, I stumble on the no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
omg crying time,
then after a while I see the <CAPACITOR>C7030</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7031</CAPACITOR> POLY-TANT.
I think fuck it, heat the bitch. and again nice long dong.
cooled down, no long dong, heated, long dong. etc.

but is there a way to test the poly-tant. in a "professional way" instead of heating the fucker......

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message: Never seen these go bad on an Air, so probably heating something else. Check voltages on both sides of <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR>/1/2/3

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message:
yup, couldn't find anything on it.
thanks for the swift reply

............pin 1 .pin 2
<RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR> 3.333 3.226 323.6k
<RESISTOR>R1801</RESISTOR> 3.334 3.046 1.003m
<RESISTOR>R1802</RESISTOR> 3.333 3.327 19.96k
<RESISTOR>R1803</RESISTOR> 3.333 3.328 19.82k

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message: That all looks fine. PPBUS and <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> voltages?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.39v (measured both sides of <RESISTOR>R6920</RESISTOR> 8,39v and at <CAPACITOR>C7200</CAPACITOR>) " this is the one where one the schematic it says 12,8v but it has 8,4volt right ?"

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>  3.3334v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message: No idea really. Double check for liquid. Press on PCH and see if it powers on.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message:
btw after looking true the microscoop sideways, I found 1 probe point that was thick probe point 460
<SIGNAL>PM_THRMTRIP_L_R</SIGNAL>
after scratching it  bit it seems its not making contact
could that cause the system to boot sometimes?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message: Not sure but looks like if that trace was broken it would not affect anything as it needs to be pulled low. Also makes no sense that when heating it up it would work.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message:
yes indeed,

coudnt see if it was broken, but when you scratch very slightly and it comes of that easy its no good imo.
maby like you said the hot air maby toutch a different part in this case the bad trace got  bit hot and connected a little ? just inuf for a small boot.

I now repaired the trace, whit hot tweezers not hot air. placed a new trace and removed the old one. (had a small point where I could connect the wire.
it now boots for 4th time in a row, it didn't do that before.

its now reinstalling the os, ill tell in a bit if its good.
will asd be of any use in this case?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message:
update, making a new trace/wire seems to have fixed the issue.

<SIGNAL>PM_THRMTRIP_L_R</SIGNAL> seems this can cause the system not to boot....

boots everytime now.

thanks duke for the help.

maby thrmtrip is something like thermaltrip something.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not start quarter fan spin.
threads.message:
you can set the status to solved, seems all good now.
asd runs perfect, full reinstalled running great.
